Legal_Issue: Whether the panel's decision was reasonable in concluding that Ms. Myle could rely on state protection in St. Vincent and the Grenadines
Application_Facts: Ms. Myle claimed refugee status due to fear of domestic violence, arguing lack of state protection in St. Vincent
Decision_Outcome: Judicial review granted, case referred back for redetermination
Remedy_Requested: Redetermination of refugee claim with consideration of up-to-date information
Court_Ruling: Case remanded for reconsideration with emphasis on current conditions and reliable sources
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of domestic violence, lack of state protection in country of origin
Assessment_Factor: Outdated or incomplete evidence, contradictory evidence ignored, credibility of claimant
Procedural_Issue: First dismissal overturned, second dismissal challenged due to improper evidence handling
Credibility_Assessment: Panel implied Ms. Myleâ€™s evidence was unreliable without justification
Evidence_Used: Outdated or incomplete evidence, contradictory evidence
Application_Basis: Relevant evidence including updated country condition information
Evidence_Assessed: State protection availability in St. Vincent and the Grenadines, domestic violence context
Governing_Rule: Panel must consider all relevant evidence, including updated information
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Reliance on outdated or incomplete evidence, failure to consider contradictory evidence
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm due to domestic violence in absence of state protection
Cause_Description: Ms. Myle claimed refugee status due to fear of domestic violence, arguing lack of state protection in St. Vincent
Evidence_Handling: Improper handling: reliance on outdated evidence, ignoring contradictions
Evidence_Issues: Outdated evidence, lack of justification for discrediting claimant
Evidence_Assessment: Failure to properly assess credibility and country condition evidence
Decision_Rationale: Decision unreasonable due to flawed evidentiary basis and lack of up-to-date information
Evidentiary_Issues: Outdated evidence, contradictory evidence ignored, unjustified credibility findings
